intro: Solanum renggeri, commonly known as the red devil or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, often reddish bark and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into bright red, fleshy berries. Solanum renggeri is part of the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
